testproblem.name: gyre_2d -- gyre on beta plane in proper 2d, uses "new navsto", and a P1DG-P2 discretisation

variables.variable: import vtktools import numpy as np f=vtktools.vtu('gyre_2.vtu') xyz=f.GetLocations() uvw=f.GetField('Velocity') # x locations of nodes with negative v-velocity downx=xyz[:,0].compress( (uvw[:,1] < -1e-9) & (xyz[:,1] > 0.5) ) # Choose the first occurance of a negative v-velocity, that isn't at x=0 # (which can occur since Dirichlet conditions are applied weakly at the boundaries in this case) western_boundary_width=min(downx[np.nonzero(downx)])

test.name: Check width of western boundary current (< 0.25).
